headline: Changing Your Sense Of Cinematic History
abstract: To Save and Project, the annual MoMA series, unearths forgotten work by Australian women, a French auteur and even George A. Romero.
lead_paragraph: Just because movies spent more than a century as physical objects — as strips of film, not the digital files of the 21st century — doesn’t mean they can’t disappear. And their loss, to decomposition or to memory, inevitably leaves gaps in knowledge.
